alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 03 at 9:56AM CST until January 03 at 10:30AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CST THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHERN PHILLIPS, NORTHERN COAHOMA, DESOTO, NORTHWESTERN MARSHALL, TATE AND TUNICA COUNTIES... At 956 AM CST, the heavy rainfall has shifted east of the area but runoff from earlier rain will continue to result in flooding across portions of north Mississippi and east-central Arkansas. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southaven, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Hernando, Senatobia, Holly Springs, Elaine, Helena-West Helena, White River National Wildlife Refuge, Coldwater, Byhalia, Friars Point, Tunica, Little Texas, Strayhorn, Phillipp, Arkabutla, Dubbs, North Tunica and Robinsonville. Several roads are closed in western DeSoto County due to high water, including Nail Road and Brantley Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
